website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for quick, easy clean up, this is a good alternative to a traditional mixer.
pros: This mixer can fit into small spaces and can mix up salsa, smoothies, batters, and soups in ways that the traditional hand or stand mixer can't
cons: Doesn't work for dense bread dough

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this SIX years ago and LOVE it. It is very sturdy, very easy to clean and is amazingly fast at pureeing anything we've tried so far. The weight is comfortable and easy to hold. I make tomato sauce and throw them in the crockpot seeds and all with seasoning and just use this to blend it down at the end. We also used it to puree pumpkins that we grow in our yard. Perfect for soups as well. Well worth the money and have had zero problems with it. We once asked a chef what would she take if her kitchen was on fire, she said her Kitchenaid mixer and this stick blender.
customer_reviews.author: Saphyress

customer_reviews.title: bait & switch
customer_reviews.text: The blender I received is not the one pictured or described. It's the cheaper version by about $20, listed here:  This one has a "low" & "high" setting and an incredibly weak motor that starts & stops on its own. It's also difficult to use because the button is so small only a single finger can depress it. Really disappointed. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Working fine
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this machine for the last six weeks and it is working fine. It is powerful enough to blend soups, smoothies, mayonnaise, greens and vegetables but not ice cubes. The design is good and the electrical body of the machine can be detached from the blending part (the blades) so that the blades can be washed and cleaned. This is certainly a wonderful product for small volume blending where food processor or traditional family size blender doesn't work. It looks great and working fine so far, if any problems develop I will update this review. 1. 2. 3.
customer_reviews.author: Rama Rao

customer_reviews.title: Mine Lasted 6.5 Years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July 2012 and I used it almost every day. I made everything from smoothies with frozen strawberries and ice cubes to pureed sweet potatoes and refried beans. It finally died on me January 2019. 6 1/2 years of near-daily use is not bad for a hand immersion blender :) I'm back to buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: A. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a few months of light usage
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product a zero, I would. Worked wonderfully the first dozen times I used it. Then it slowly started coming disconnected at the hinge and finally it would not stick at all. The blade would work half of the time. Cuisinart quality overall has gone down over the years. We had a coffee pot by Cuisinart that died in less than a year as well. Needless to say I will not be purchasing Cuisinart products in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to last
customer_reviews.text: While it worked it was great. Unfortunately the rubber gasket that keeps the blade in the shaft broke and the blender is now no longer usable. I wouldn't consider my use excessive but the way it broke was just sad. It was great while it lasted but I definitely wouldn't pay full price for another one knowing it won't last. I'm a bit apprehensive of Cuisinart products in general now.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler P

customer_reviews.title: convenient
customer_reviews.text: Product is conducive to blending small batches. Only issue is the slight awkwardness of pushing two buttons simultaneously. My prior similar blender (one button) just broke but we had it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't Used this a few times over ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it didn't Used this a few times over the years and then used it recently and the blade wouldn't spin anymore. The motor was turning but the blade won't spin.
customer_reviews.author: meadandale

customer_reviews.title: Really baffled by all the great reviews
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Cuisinart hand blender and am already thinking of sending it back. This product doesn't even properly blend frozen bananas, and frozen bananas are actually pretty soft. I cut them up into small cubes and this just does not do the trick. I can't imagine trying to make a smoothie with ice in it. It also does not have the feel of a quality product. The "brushed silver" I got is just grey colored plastic. The motor also runs EXTREMELY hot, to the point of being worrisome. Just trying to make a smoothie with only frozen bananas and milk makes the motor seem to overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Creams like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, quiet immersion blender. I bought the turquoise and the color is beautiful. There is one speed on this baby, but that's all you need. It will puree soups to creamy perfection - potato, broccoli, cauliflower, pea...anything and without hassle and the risk of burning yourself while transferring to your blender. I've had this since February 2012 and use it regularly. I have not had one problem with it. I know some people had some complaints about it not lasting, this has not been the case for me. Very easy to clean and use. It's comfortable in the hand while using it. I use to have a cheapy one before this one and the difference is remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: The Bearded Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cauliflower mash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pretty much exclusively to make cauliflower mashed "potatoes" and it works great! It is very easy to clean, as you just pop out the blade portion and throw it in the dishwasher, and the power/strength is perfect for boiled cauliflower. I can blend them super smooth into almost a puree, or leave them chunkier for more chunky mash, which when you put butter and salt in, tastes just like a low carb version of mashed potatoes! I usually blend right in the pot I cooked the cauliflower in, but I just realized that it might have come with a cup that I have never used (and possibly lost??) after looking at the thumbnail photo!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: 8 yr lasting workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: love this blender. Works hard, great for all kinds of soups, smoothies, blending separated peanut butter. Blending baby food was easy. Mine just broke, after 8 years. Really wish it was still the original price I bought it at! The motor still works, but something is causing the blades to no longer turn. I'm not sure if it's the resistance, or somethings broken, but after 8 years it's a goner.
customer_reviews.author: R. Emrath

customer_reviews.title: I liked the older model better
customer_reviews.text: The new handle with the safety lock on the top of the handle makes it very difficult to navigate and mix. You can not blend and move the blades up and down, as the minute you raise the blades everything turns off.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Hand Blender
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a (long coveted) birthday present. I haven't used it a lot yet, but it has worked very well for the few tasks I've tried. It blended french toast batter, blueberry sauce, and baby food with ease. I really like the measuring/blending cup as well. It's super easy to put together and take apart and clean (I throw it in the dishwasher). I also like that it's very tall so I don't worry about getting to the bottom of my taller pots. Seems very well built and I'm sure I'll be using it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT ISN'T JUST TRYING TO "BLEND" IN.  ;-)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SmartStick. The gearing was off a little on my last model and the efficiency wasn't very good anymore. The motor was still strong and I would have just purchased a new blade attachment, but the price was equal to a whole new device. I use this almost everyday sometimes several times in a day. I absolutely love this! It is light, powerful, relatively quiet, and super useful. AND it's super easy to clean. I didn't hesitate buying a new one at all. I consider this item a necessity for my kitchen and if you mix, blend, or make smoothies then you will too.
customer_reviews.author: Doc34

customer_reviews.title: Save time and energy with this handy gadget!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for quite a while now and could not be happier with it. It is well built and has truly made cooking quicker and more convenient. If you frequently make your own sauces, you will be satisfied with this blender. You do not have to transfer anything to a blender and then back to the pot after blending (and then cleanup!). You simply put the blender down into the mixture that you want to blend and it is done right in the pot. It also makes great smoothies with ease!! To clean, you simply remove the blade piece and rinse under hot water. For the price, it is a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Good Value & Ergonomic Design.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a well-made and very easy to use blender. I needed it for pureeing hot soups that were far to messy and slightly dangerous to be doing in the regular blender. First, it looks great and feels solid. When I wrap my hand around it and press the button, it feels just right. I like the ergonomics of the thing. It blends well....I have made a few soups and homemade whipped cream with it. The blade attachment comes off very easily, and is also easy to clean. The only thing I would want that this doesn't have is variable speeds, but this is just quibbling. For what I spent, I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: A much needed addition to any kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This stick blender is awesome. It makes milk frothing on the stove easy, and it's excellent for making sauces - including a pretty good version of hollandaise - with very little mess, comparatively. The design is also great. It stands as shown in the product picture without damaging the blade, and it comes apart (and reattaches solidly) in the middle so that you can wash the bottom without getting the motor housing wet. I suggest a Velcro strap for the power cord, and it will store nicely and compactly as well. A very nice tool for the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: MussSyke

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Reading reviews for this product that bordered almost on worship, convinced me to part with 30 dollars for this blender. So far, I have not been disappointed. Pureeing, blending and liquefying is a breeze thanks to the very quiet and sharp motor. The surface is great looking ( i chose green) and the detachable shaft is very easy to clean. Many reviewers have expressed concern that the shaft break and the materials are cheap but I did not think so. I will revisit these concerns with an update in the future, but I must advise that be careful and gentle when removing the shaft for washing. A great product and a fantastic price.
customer_reviews.author: Amit Talpade

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful blender!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a different (cheaper) brand and it was unsatisfactory. The design of the Cuisinart CSB-76BC is superior in a couple of ways: 1) the scalloped edge enables the food to be blended to get into the cupped area where the blade is, and 2) the immersion stick part doesn't fall off the handle during the blending process. This immersion blender is very powerful. I've used it for soups such as cauliflower soup, and it's not necessary to chop everything into tiny pieces prior to making the soup; the blender will take care of it and make a smooth soup.
customer_reviews.author: N. H. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great, cost-efficient baby food maker!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cost-efficient alternative to those expensive baby food makers and it works great! I cook baby's food in a little pot, and then pop this in and boom - nice, homemade baby food is made! It comes in a nice range of colors and is incredibly easy to use. You just blend it longer if you want baby food to be more smooth. It's easy to wash - pop into the dishwasher. WHen baby grows out of baby food, I plan to use this to make soups, milkshakes, etc. Great little product!
customer_reviews.author: Truffle

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLY THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these blenders in brushed chrome. My first one I took down to my house in Brazil. I have a second and newer one here in America. I originally bought it to mix my protein powder with water. (It clumps if I don't.) I'm vegetarian and I need my protein on a daily basis. The newer version is much better since you can unhook the blades from the body unit to clean it. It's sturdy and super powerful and loaded with possibilities in the kitchen. Turns out my husband became a fan too. He uses it for a myriad of things in his cooking. One hell of a blender!
customer_reviews.author: Ana Luiza WelchTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: I can make pureed soups now
customer_reviews.text: I use this blender mostly to puree soups, so I can't comment on people's negative experiences with the unit breaking when working with harder ingredients. For my purpose it's wonderful. I used to do the whole thing of pouring soup into the blender and back into the stock pot, and I actually avoided making those types of soups because of the hassle. Now it's just a matter of cooking the soup, sticking the blender in it, and a finished product 30 seconds later. Love it! It would probably work well for smoothies and baby food as well, but for harder items, I'd go back to the regular blender or food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Solnishko

customer_reviews.title: Still Adapting from a Regular Blender
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hand-held blender, so I'm at the bottom of the learning curve. When my old, regular blender died, I got this one to replace it for the convenience of blending soups in their pots and to save some storage space. So far, I've used it twice. Once to make pureed pumpkin soup and once to make tomato sauce. It worked well for both of those tasks, but took longer than I expected. Also, it did splash a bit. That was probably my own fault, since I used a wide, shallow pan instead of a pot--but it is something to keep in mind. I look forward to using it more and being able to precent these small inconveniences!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Has held up well
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 4 years and have probably used it to make at least 1000 smoothies. It has never failed me, and I can't imagine it ever dying. It can power its way through ice, frozen fruit and the thickest materials that you can throw at it. The stainless steel base is nice if you want to use it in hot pot to puree soup, but we just use it to make smoothies. The cup has held up well also - it's pretty scratched up, but there's no cracks even though it's been used about 1000 times and been through the dishwasher at least 500 times. If ours ever dies, we'll buy the same one.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisM

customer_reviews.title: Died suddenly
customer_reviews.text: This did the job while it lasted. I bought it in April, 2012; it died on me for no apparent reason in June, 2015. That's 2 months after the 3-year warrantee expired. I would say that possibly it would have died within the warrantee period if I were a more frequent user. Very disappointing and inconvenient. I had higher expectations. Next I'll try the Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.author: Zoro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for soups and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I use this a lot to make soups. I've had it for many years and it's still holding up extremely well. I also used it to make homemade baby food. The cord is long enough, easy to use, easy to clean and it doesn't scratch the bottom of my bowls.
customer_reviews.author: violaplayer

customer_reviews.title: Great for soups and smoothies
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for about a year, still in perfect condition. I used to have a plastic one and it got misshapen when used in hot soups. I love that I can use this in hot soup and not worry. So easy to clean as the blade end snaps off. Very powerful - I use ice and frozen bananas to make a smoothie and it comes out the perfect consistency. Add some cocoa powder and you basically have chocolate ice cream with no sugar or fat. It can also handle pureeing thick batches of cooked food (lentils, rice, etc.) that I make for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Judith P.

customer_reviews.title: Make creamy soups without cream!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart Smartstick Hand Blender. The previous one eventually died, but I liked it well enough to order a new one. I have arthritis in my hands, so ergonomics and the weight of the tool are important aspects in my decision. This tool is easy to use, easy to clean, and does an excellent job. I love being able to cook a pot of soup, then use the hand blender to create a soup that is creamy in texture but does not have any additional fat. Every soup comes out looking beautiful. I use this to make smoothies too; it's a quick way to whip up a frosty beverage.
customer_reviews.author: Robin R

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender so much. It has helped us make homemade baby food for 2 little ones so far. Making baby food sounded like a chore was an incredibly easy task thanks to this gadget. I bought this one for a friend as soon as I heard she was expecting. We also use this to purée canned tomatoes before adding them to sauces, and to help with gravy when it gets a little lumpy. And, thanks to this gadget, we can make the easiest and best meatloaf ever by puréeing a jar of salsa to mix with the ground meat and a pack of crackers and an egg. Super simple and delicious. I highly recommend this blender.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Love my hand held blender!
customer_reviews.text: I think I've had this blender for a couple of months now, and I REALLY like it. Never had a hand held blender before and it is so easy to use and to clean. I just use a bottle brush to swab it off around the blades --- takes a couple seconds --- nothing to disassemble and wash and reassemble, etc. etc. So far I've only used it for my fruit smoothie, but I have a smoothie for breakfast every day. Have been careful with ice --- I let my frozen fruit thaw out a little, and pre-chop it into smaller pieces before I blend. Am very glad I got this blender!
customer_reviews.author: Pink Frog

customer_reviews.title: Nice immersion blender for cooking and soaping
customer_reviews.text: Love this immersion blender! The turquoise color is really cute and it makes blending hot soup easy. No pouring scalding soup into the blender and out. Blend the soup right in your soup pot on the stove. I bought one for soaping in a different color if you're looking for one for soaping. It works well and I have not had any problem with either of my immersion blenders.
customer_reviews.author: F.Y.

customer_reviews.title: not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: we have older one with out the safety lock or two speed. the new two speed and safety lock are impossible to use with single hand. buttons are real hard to push and hold to keep running. would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Greg Nosbush

customer_reviews.title: Become He-Man master of the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making personal size smoothies, salsa, protein shakes, etc. its kind of a pain to clean under the blade gaurd, buts thats the only negative I have. Its easy enough to use that an old woman can comfortable hold it. There isn't a lot of kickback so you dont have to worry about losing control of it. Also the blade guard keeps whatever it is your blending from getting everywhere. Side note: It makes a perfect gift.
customer_reviews.author: MuffinPowa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make smoothies in the morning before work. I keep bags of fruit in my freezer and then dump them in the measuring cup the mixer came with. I microwave the cup of fruit for 30 seconds so it's not frozen solid still, add some orange juice and then use the blender. It mixes up very quickly and then all I do is detach the blade and rinse it in the sink. Be careful not to get the part of the blade that connects to the handle wet. My mom has had one of these for a year or two and hers is still in perfect working condition.
customer_reviews.author: Brit S

customer_reviews.title: love this little machine
customer_reviews.text: love this little machine!! can't imagine what my life was before it, lol. homemade mayo has never been so easy and fast, literally in less than a minute! easy to clean, easy to use, great color, the possibilities are endless. it's very sturdy, runs a little long and bulkier than others i've seen, but you can hold it easily. you do have to keep pressing down the button, it doesn't stay on automatically, but it's no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Cynderelli

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: The hand blender is light and easy to use. It has plenty of power for almost any job. The blade assembly disconnects from the motor housing and can be cleaned in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in KC

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for soups
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this blender for over a year with great success. I love that I can make blended veggie soups in the cook pot without transferring hot soup to my old blender! Also you can make whipped cream using the provided container like a champ. However it doesn't work for really thick mixes, like cream cheese blocks for cheesecake so I still need my old mixer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moe

customer_reviews.title: **Warning: Don't Buy This Product!**
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this item, you will love it. It will seem like magic--suddenly those blended soups practically make themselves! Awesome! But, if your experience is like mine, even though you baby your appliances, even though you hand wash everything, even though you never drop the item, around the 10th use it will simply STOP WORKING. I read the reviews, and I knew it could happen. I took the chance thinking that those other people just didn't take care of their things. Guess what? I was wrong. This is a terrible product! If it can't survive ten uses, it isn't worth buying. Save yourself the money and time...and disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Afterthoughts

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one of these for so long but wasn't sure how much use I would get out of it. Easy to use, easy to clean, easy to store. Very convenient - especially for small amounts of food, such as baby food, or custom smoothies. No more dragging out the traditional blender. One word of caution: do not use to make mashed potatoes - it over processes the starches into a gooey glue-like substance. Makes sense - and that's probably why you have never heard of more people making mashed potatoes using a traditional blender, much less a stick blender.
customer_reviews.author: jesr

customer_reviews.title: Love-it!
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason why this gadget is at the top of the heap--it's super! I used to make smoothies in a regular blender, which was often a pain to rinse out. This has a detachable section which you wash easily. I make my smoothies in the cup which comes with it--easy as pie and just as good--a little non-fat yogurt, non-fat milk or water, frozen fruit, and whey protein powder and I've got a healthy smoothie any time of the day in seconds. I've been really pleased. I've also used this for soups and for mixing batter and things and it works great. For under 25 dollars it's an amazing buy. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sundancerguy

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: perfect! had it for over 4 years and i use it daily, at least 25 out of 30 days a month. things blended include: from most to least: Protien, ice (not alot at one time but pretty often, coffee beans, fruit, MISC. powders. when i bought it though it was only 44.95$ so if theres a cheaper one buy that, 99$ is way OP. i blen in a large 32 oz mason jar, when you think theres gonna be a mess, just pput your hand around the stem of the unit and all the splash will hit your palm, so no worries on clean up, way more convient than a blender for someone who serves 1-3 people at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The product is OK, but not as helpful as desired.
customer_reviews.text: The SmartStick works well in liquid that has only very little fruit added. If drink is thin (plain milk, juice) performance is good - liquid is stirred thoroughly, but adding honey or a few pieces of fruit causes performance to become inconsistent. An eight ounce smoothie has to be worked in, at least, two parts in order to get a well blended result. Blending in stages is the best way to get the texture consistency that I want This product was pruchased to save time, but requires more time rather than less.
customer_reviews.author: A T

customer_reviews.title: Work horse
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing!!! I used it for everything and it never failed! It's easy to use, easy to clean, and small enough to store in small spaces!
customer_reviews.author: dabee5

customer_reviews.title: thanksgiving time saver
customer_reviews.text: bought this for help with my thanksgiving prep my daugher in law has one and uses it all the time so I thought I would treat myself. I didnt get her more expensive version so I was not sure I would like this one as much well I love it love it fast blending and right in the pot easy clean up works perfectly for blending soup that other wise would have to be put into a food processor even whipped up the whip cream for pies in seconds one of my fav kitchen appliances now hope you love yours as much
customer_reviews.author: C. Truelove

customer_reviews.title: Still at it
customer_reviews.text: This has proven to be a workhorse for me. I have used it for smoothies (no ice, just fruit, yogurt, etc) and also for soap making. It speeds the saponification reaction. Anyway, for a couple of years now it has worked well, with only a few hiccups. The slipping that has been mentioned by some has occurred perhaps 5 times in two years, but it easily re-engaged each time when the blender was disconnected, held upside down and gently turned by hand. (UNPLUG or DISCONNECT FIRST!) The upshot is, there is a small flaw somewhere in the business end but not a serious one. The unit still works well, and I am happy with it at the price.
customer_reviews.author: peter painter

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE HANDIEST little appliance for thr kitchen. Virtually NO cleanup time and so many uses. The additional beauty is using it directly in a pot....or a bowl. I hardly take out a big guns food processor (often accompanied by a strainer for pureed food) This gizmo is a gem and I sing its praises everytime it comes out of the cabinet .... and that's often. GREAT to have. WONDERFUL gift for those unsuspecting or unaware. So inexpensive and does the job of so many bigger ticket items easily. If you don't have one....get one. Cuisinart, by the way makes the best of these.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Konigsberg

customer_reviews.title: Since I discovered this, I haven't used the Osterizer mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Forget the bother of disassembling that Osterizer mixer! This is a hoot!!!! Fast, powerful, EASY cleaning..... I had two quarts of tomatoes in a pot and this reduced them to juice no problemo! Be a little bit patient, as the single head is not going to be a tough as the Osterizer - - but on the other hand, you can't pick up the Osterizer in one hand easily like you can this Cuisinart Smart Stick, and this is so much more convenient to clean. I wouldn't use mine to chop up ice cubes - - but hey, why don't you just chew them like a normal person who doesn't mind breaking their teeth?
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyJohn

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in the kitchen besides the stove.
customer_reviews.text: This little tool makes short work of a creamed soup without having to pull out the VitaMix and wash it afterwards. The sharp blade and powerful motor work well. This also works well to make a quick fruit smoothie, in the cup even. You have to make sure enough liquid is available to facilitate engagement of the blades to the mix but that applies to the counter top blenders as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yoshimoto

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit primarily for use in making purees. Cat food purees, that is. We have 5 very old cats who are very finicky eaters. They do like canned cat food made into a paste with water. Unfortunately, this takes forever with a fork. There is a bit of waste when using the SmartStick, but that is only because it whips the food into such a creamy consistency, very quickly. It is very easy to clean. I knock off one star for the simple fact that it is made in China and not the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Rational

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great, it's cute
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This thing is great, it's cute, works well and easy to store away when you don't need it. I first bought this so that I could stir up my bulletproof coffee in the mornings, and it worked great for that. I no longer drink bpc, but this still comes in handy for mixing soups or for some baking needs. It's really easy to clean as well, the half with the mixer pops off and can go into the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Andria

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Hand StickBlender
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Cuisinart CSB-76BC to replace an old Protor Silex stick blender, that served me well. What I like about this product is the ease in clean up. Being able to wash the lower unit, without having to emerse the motor not only proves safe, but practical. Since I've only had the appliance about a month now, I rate it at 4 stars,....to soon to tell how long it'll last. However, considering the great purchase price, and ease of ordering on Amazon, I'd be more that happy if I get a few good years of service from this product. So far so good,... :)
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Smoothies, batters, puree and Creams!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this for whoever is planning to make anything of the above, follow the instructions though so if you are using ice, crush it a little before because it wont handle big pieces. I myself prefer to use cut fruit as ice, it adds more flavor into my smoothies. And when it comes to creams and soups, NO SCARY burning anymore, (I had a bad episode with a regular blender, making Potato soup, I literally burned my wrist), so this hand blender is so much safer and EASY TO CLEAN. Go for it, because it's easy to clean, it works and it doesn't take that much space.
customer_reviews.author: JC. G.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cuisinart Csb-76 handblender after checking other reviews. I use it primarily to puree baby food. It works great. Very sharp. Easy to use. Purees well. Easy to clean because the bottom half detaches and is submersible. Only downside is that it's best to rinse it immediately after using it or else it's hard to wash out the food from near the blades without cutting one's self. The cup that comes with it is just the right size to make an entire icecube tray worth of baby food.
customer_reviews.author: Fox-Fyr

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient for making soups etc
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient for making soups etc. No need to transfer things to a blender, just blend it in the pan. We have had this for many years and haven't had any problems at all. They are very inexpensive and we have given several as gifts and everyone loves them! Update: I just noticed that we paid $26.88 for this in Dec of 2011 and it's still going strong. What a bargain!!!
customer_reviews.author: Balanced Life

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand blender! I got it to replace another brand that died after good use, and I like this one better. To separate the parts is very simple, and to use it is very easy. Mostly I use it to make protein shakes, using about 6-7 ice cubes. Once, one of my standard freezer-sized ice cubes jammed the blades, and I had to extract it. So I got some slightly smaller ice cubes and haven't had a problem since. It seems very powerful, and takes no time at all to prepare my shake. A nice plus was the graduate that came with it. Price was very reasonable and I am extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: Hardworking little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Have used it everyday for over a year to make 2 smoothies using frozen fruit, as well as soups for dinner. Recently it's started making a high pitched screeching noise when it's over worked but it's not a huge deal. I don't regret this purchase, best one I've made recently. I'm going to be getting a blender for bigger jobs but this will still be my go to for soups and smoothies. I've also used the measuring cup for lots of other recipes when my other one was dirty, great products!
customer_reviews.author: raieven

customer_reviews.title: Great stick blender
customer_reviews.text: Ive owned several of these. After an accident with one that nearly took the end of my finger off I went several years without one (never try to clean out the blade area with your finger, no matter what kind of hurry you are in!) I got this at Christmas because i was really missing the ability to puree soups right in the pan. It is great. It works perfectly, great for soups! I do wish it had a higher speed sometimes but it gets the job done. Dont use it for mashed potatoes, not a great consistency. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SRL

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for over a year now and it still blends quickly. I bought it to replace a Hamilton Beach Immersion blender that was poorly designed and only lasted about 6 months. This Cuisinart is strong (I even use it in place of my food processor sometimes) and very easy to clean (dishwasher safe). I use it almost everyday to make baby food, hummus, soup, small smoothies, milkshakes, etc. It works best in the narrow cup it comes with or a similarly narrow container.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I like to start on low speed to control better and ...
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a hand blender for our kitchen and decided to try this immersion blender. It has two speeds which is very helpful and can quickly make soups and hummus, which are the main things we use this blender for. I like to start on low speed to control better and switch to higher as the food becomes more pureed. Nice weight to it, does not feel too flimsy even though it is small. The blade is pretty easy to detach as well so cleaning is quick and convenient. Finally, love the turquoise colour!
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Have to find more uses for this!
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted one of these to do basic mixing or puree work in the kitchen - soups and other liquid-based recipes. I have to say the unit works well but it turns out I have a lot less use for it than I thought I would. When I need it I like how easy, powerful and simple it is to use. Plug in and go, but the uses are less and less when I often rely on my Vitamix blender or other tools to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: JLee

customer_reviews.title: it does it!
customer_reviews.text: this is a sweet SmartStick! I had a Braun for more than 20 years and it finally stopped dead! so I ordered this one and I do like the features--comes apart for washing, the color is FUN... It is still "new" but I expect to give it good care, and get many years' service from it. I gave 4, not 5-star rating, as its handle attaches/seats onto the base with PLASTIC contacts. so we will see some thoughtless owners jamming forcing and breaking and COMPLAINING--what's new!
customer_reviews.author: rudydot

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gadget to eliminate the need for a blender sitting on my counter.or having to dirty up my food processor. I often need to get lumps out of something or need to puree soup items. I like to make quick soups and appreciate thickening them with a puree of some of the broth and vegetables. This unit couldn't work better. the only improvements I could recommend would be a slightly larger cup for things like milkshakes or mixed drinks. I would also love it if it was cordless. The blade attachment disconnects and cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A. Marcella

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love our Cuisinart immersion blender. It is much easier to use than a regular blender, saving you not only the steps of moving stuff to and from the blender while cooking like in the case of soups, but also cutting down tremendously on cleanup. It also performs exceptionally well. Even on larger pots of soup, this gets the job done in a timely manner and with less effort than transferring to a blender. It also makes great immersions, and I use it regularly to make vinaigrette. It also ages well. My blender is over four years old now, and is still performing just as well as when I bought it. I highly recommend this immersion blender.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J Tyler

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this! But not any more
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, easy to use, very powerful. I use it all the time and love it. I highly recommend this product. I purchaed another one as my daughter took my old one. They have made changes. Now it has 2 speeds. the lower speed is useless and the safety lock is a pain in the neck. It makes this unit much harder to use with one hand. The Presue needed to keep it on is much harder as well. They just couldn't leave well enough alone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I use this hand blender a lot to make soup. It works well and is easy to use. I do take care to wash it immediately after use, so clean up is never an issue. I thought that the plastic measuring cup that came with it would be something more to clutter my cabinets. However, because it has the tall sides, it's been useful when blending small amounts of vegi's before adding to my other ingredients. Plus I store the blender head inside the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Vt

customer_reviews.title: Great Blending Stick
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this blender stick. I use it everyday to make my shakes. I do soften the frozen fruit just a bit because it takes less time to purée it. I was amazed that the measuring cup held all I put in my shake eliminating having to use a larger glass. This has replaced taking out the blender and the cleanup afterwards. The stick is easily cleaned and very portable. It appears to be very reliable and would recommend it. Glad I decided to buy it at such a great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Readsinidaho

customer_reviews.title: Planned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: I bought the unit in May of this year. All was well until the wand portion rolled onto the floor. Although there is no visible sign of damage, the unit no longer turns. I contacted Cusinart, told them what happened with the hopes they might offer me the opportunity to purchase a new wand section. Had I lied and told them it just stopped working, they might have covered it under warranty. In telling the truth and in finding that I can not purchase the replacement wand, I find I have spent $29.95 for nothing. A manufacture that doesn't offer the opportunity to purchase replacement parts has taken planned obsolescence a little too far in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Beckett

customer_reviews.title: these work great for mixing especially custards and things that you are ...
customer_reviews.text: these work great for mixing especially custards and things that you are cooking. the down side is that the first one that i purchased, i was using on the stove and the cord touched the side of the pot and shorted out -- so, i bought another and pay closer attention. the good news is that i can still use the silver part - this comes apart very easily and is dishwasher safe. very user friendly - fab.
customer_reviews.author: caliZon

customer_reviews.title: Greatest thing in your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest thing since slice bread. I use it all the time when I make soups and sometimes sauces. It pulverises any thing in the pot in a minute or two. It's great for vegetable soups where you just pulverize half the vegetables if you want. It's the best for creamy soups. I also use it when I make spaghetti sauces. Cleaning it is literally a 5 second job. It couldn't be easier. It's very well made and looks as if it could last for several years.. Very good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kareem Said

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it works, maybe too well
customer_reviews.text: Although this unit works fairly well, be advised, it does have quite a bit of power, and if you are careless, you will have frothy something all over the place. (I guess I am saying it has plenty of power, but like all power it needs to be controlled--and this unit only has one speed, high. ) I have kind of stopped using this as I have a new little battery powered unit that has plenty of power for simple things like frothing milk and it is easier to clean (and a moderate amount of power).
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Sandberg

customer_reviews.title: Best small kitchen appliance EVER
customer_reviews.text: I received this Smartstick yesterday-I used it this morning to make baby food for my twin granddaughters. This made quick and neat work of a meatball and carrots. Instead of using my huge food processor and having to wash all those parts, I used this with the cup it came with and within 2 minutes I had a full jar of baby food done. I have used the Kidpro manual food mill and a regular blender-this is by far faster and neater and easier. LOVE IT-you must have this item especially if you have babies or grand-babies.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Boop

customer_reviews.title: Results count
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my wife as an early Christmas present and I was glad I did. I wanted grilled ham and cheese with tomato soup one night. Guess what? We didn't have any tomato soup so she used this hand blender to make tomato soup from, here it comes...actual tomatoes. Wow! It was the best tomato soup ever and I told her to never buy tomato soup in a can again. This product works very well and is a good value based on price and function.
customer_reviews.author: George S. Nieldan

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I have been pleased with this purchase and find that it works very well. I have used this product to mix cold processed soap and will not be using it on food products. It is not very loud although it does make some noise. I like the weight and handle of the product. The only problem I have had with it is during cleaning the blade it can be difficult to get above the blade. This would be a bigger problem I think if I were using food. Otherwise, this is a great product! Oh and the side cup is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This stick blender is a bit larger than I expected, which is a good thing. It is heavy and well-made, and it works like gangbusters. It is a real powerhouse. It blended up a whole family-size pot of leek and potato soup with no problem. I haven't tried it on smaller portions yet, but I can see already that I will have to put a smaller portion in a deeper, narrow container with lots of head room or I am sure it would spray it all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Vallejos

customer_reviews.title: save TIME save SPACE save ENERGY
customer_reviews.text: My last immersion blender was 16 years old and also a Cuisinart. It only bit the dust because I dropped it on the floor and the housing cracked. So after reading reviews on Amazon I picked this guy. It has all the power I'll need. I'm impressed and LOVE LOVE LOVE that it comes apart for super easy storage in my drawer! And clean up is breezy quick with no worry of getting water in or around motor section. Smart. Must have been redesigned by a woman. Ya' know what I mean? Worth every little penny that it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Baker

customer_reviews.title: Detachable blade assembly makes for easier cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a Kitchen Gourmet handheld blender, which worked for years and sadly gave it up recently. Replacing it with the Cuisinart has been a so so experience. It is nice enough, and it does have the detachable blade assembly, which allows you to unsnap part of the unit to wash in the kitchen sink. The cord does have a habit of becoming twisted over time. I am sure I will get used to the new unit, and it does work well enough. IF it was to disappear tomorrow, I would buy another without regret.
customer_reviews.author: ichibrosan

customer_reviews.title: Simply rocks
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart immersion blender is amazing. I'd put some broccoli, Brussel sprouts and green beans on to steam while I worked out and then decided to see if I could make soup for dinner. Dumped the veggies in a container, added a little raw milk, stuck the blender in and zip, zap, it's soup! Add a little Himalayan salt and left-over steak and my post-workout hunger was appeased in no time. I really like the fact that the shaft detaches for cleaning and is dishwasher safe. I think my Vitamix is jealous.
customer_reviews.author: JC Warren

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy baby purees
customer_reviews.text: Love this hand blender! I've used it many times to make small batches of baby purees as I couldn't justify spending ridiculous amounts of money on "baby blenders". Tried to use a food processer, but I rarely needed to make huge amounts of baby food and this was perfect. Super smooth purees every time and very easy to clean. And now that baby girl is out of the puree stage, I've been using this blender to make yummy soups!
customer_reviews.author: KCT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent (inexpensive) tool for frequent blenders
customer_reviews.text: Most people probably do not need an immersion blender. But if you're reading reviews online, you must have some use, so I highly recommend this. Easy to use, feels sturdy and safe, and although I've only blended a few things (fruits, veggies, pudding), it's worked well. Best feature: It's easy to clean. I hate assembling my regular blender, using it for a few minutes, awkwardly scraping food from the glass canister (leaving a lot behind), and then disassembling it and cleaning every little part. This cuts down mess substantially, and you can blend in your preparation or serving dish, you waste a bit less food.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Avery

customer_reviews.title: Love it, made a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first immersion blender we have ever owned and we are in love with it. I purchased it as a gift for my fiance. He uses it to create blended soups and sauces in a jiffy. It's super easy to use and a breeze to clean. As soon as we are done blending, we wash the bottom half, dry it and put the whole rig back in the cabinet. I bought it last year and it's still going strong, no issues. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: HelloHello

customer_reviews.title: Makes great smoothies.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for smoothies but I use it for so much more! It works great for ice cream shakes, protein shakes or blending a hot soup on the stove. I use the Cuisinart CSB-76bC Smart Stick about 5 times a week and it's always sharp and powerful. I've had lesser more inexpensive brands but they can't hold a candle to the Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Tenny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price. It is sturdy, has good power to it and is slim enough to fit in my kitchen drawer. Previously, I had a Philips Immersion blender. I used it for years and years, it too was an excellent product, but came with multiple attachments that I never used but still needed to store. It came with a wall mount that was excellent for storage. I thought I would miss it, but this unit fits easily in a drawer unlike the Phillips. I really recommend this unit. It is an excellent buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This immersion hand blender is the best purchase I've made in a long time. I used to have to puree all my soups in small batches through my countertop blender (after waiting a sufficient time to allow the soup to cool.) Now, I can take it right off my stove and insert the hand blender immediately. It blends all my chunky soups in only a couple of minutes. I've had it for 2 months and haven't had any problems with it. I highly recommend purchasing one...soon!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Bad idea. My second Cusinart SmartStick blender stopped working ...
customer_reviews.text: When my first Cuisinart SmartStick blender stopped working after less than 2 years of occasional use, I figured I got a dud and purchased a new one to replace it. Bad idea. My second Cusinart SmartStick blender stopped working today. It was purchased just over two years ago, and was used only occasionally (0-2 times a month.) Now I'm shopping for a new immersion blender, and it's definitely not going to be a Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: So useful and will last forever
customer_reviews.text: This hand blender has been around forever because it is the best there is. My mom has one, I remember her using it all the time. Now I have one and use it all the time. Now I am a mom, and use it all the time. My mom's is still working, and mine is still working. It is simple, works, and lasts. What is better than that? Oh, and it was AWESOME colors. Now you can have fun and make a statement while getting a great product. Don't look further.
customer_reviews.author: puffcurls

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It makes blending soups and stuff so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: William Viands

customer_reviews.title: Best stick blender out there
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best stick blender out there. I lost my previous one so I had to get a new one. The price has gone up by almost $20 but I feel like it is still worth it. This is very durable as well. I used my last one almost everyday for about three years and it always did the job. I also love how easy it is to clean.
customer_reviews.author: cumplir

customer_reviews.title: Works well - there are probably better ones out there but this does the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional chef by any means but I do cook nearly every day and in the winter, soups and sauces are on the menu fairly regularly. I'm sure there are better, more professional, more powerful, etc. models available but this did a very nice job of smoothing out vegetable soups, tomato sauces, gravies, etc. I like it and it works. Clean-up is easy. The cord is long enough to reach anywhere on the stove surface but not too long to truly get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Jack

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Blender-LSW
customer_reviews.text: It is so user friendly and you don't have to read a manual to use it. It is easy to operate, quiet, and really works terrific! The best part is that the blender piece pops right off so it so easy to clean - what a big plus for a Mother of two! I just really love this blender. My old one broke and my Mom bought this one for me for Christmas. She bought it from Amazon because of your great reviews. Thank you reviewers for taking the time to submit your comments - they were all true!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but not Chrome
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender- I use it for salad dressing, mayo, smoothies- it's great. Easy to clean. The only complaints I have is that "chrome" body is gray plastic, not chrome, and it really can't handle whole ice cubes, they have to be crushed first. The other problem, which is why I can't give it more stars, is that the blade housing will scratch your pots, destroying any non-stick coating. You can't hold it up from the bottom because of the suction created by the spinning blades.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, works and cleans up well. Has lasted way longer than expected.
customer_reviews.text: after years of use, I just now get around to comment on this. It works and cleans up great. Have been using almost on a daily basis and it continues to work (blade getting a little dull, but it still gets it done. I had purchased another one to replace the original (as I figured it was only a matter of time before it burned out, but still haven't had to use the new one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Xterra rocks!

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom. She had been using my immersion blender, the(which I love). For the price this is a great tool. It's powerful enough to blend up cooked butternut squash and potatoes into soup. I wouldn't use it for whipping potatoes or anything like that, but it's good as an immersion blender. It has only one speed, which is fine for most of the things you'll use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Best lil tool ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lil tool ever, man I didn't know it existed until I wanted to try a recipe that called for it. I order it and now I use it for all kinds of thing. You won't be sorry you bought this and then to get is not bad. However I do see these in stores now and they r a bit cheaper. I'm glad I bought this one, it works great for creaming soups, smoothies. Nothing is to cold or to hot for this lil machine. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Lady bishop

customer_reviews.title: My best friend after wisdom tooth extraction
customer_reviews.text: Before I had this I had to dump piping hot soup into a blender and run it in batches, making everything a holy mess that I loathed to clean up. But I got my wisdom teeth out in the fall of last year and wanted something quick and easy and got this. What a time saver. I've never had smoother soups, either. I use it in a pinch in the mornings to make quick smoothies or shakes before work, too.
customer_reviews.author: DMHodor

customer_reviews.title: Do you need it? No -- Do you want it? YES
customer_reviews.text: Depending on the type of cooking you do, this can be very helpful and well worth the money. YouTube has many unboxings, demos and evaluations. This model was generally well spoken of, and appears to be more than adequate for typical home use. Will it replace a counter top blender? NO. Is it handy to blend/puree in a sauce pan? You better believe it!
customer_reviews.author: George McDuffee

customer_reviews.title: love this hand blender
customer_reviews.text: The little hand blender is so powerful! The first time I used it was to make a simple balsamic vinaigrette. It worked so fast what I got was balsamic mayonnaise! That was a wonderful surprise, didn't know you could do that! I made a great dip that night. Love the color too! Mine is magenta but this link will get you there.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Harris

customer_reviews.title: Best feature - extremely easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have plenty of kitchen appliances and the fate of most of them is to be put away in the garage, rarely being used...enter the Cuisinart Hand Blender!!! This thing is awesome. It works exactly as it should and the best part is how easy it is to clean when you're done! In addition, it's small and compact, so it's also a space saver! It is a little loud, but what would you expect from a blender - it should make some noise! This product comes totally recommended from me!
customer_reviews.author: Carolin S.

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and super easy to clean! It does get a little warm after using it on and off for a couple minutes and the cord is almost always in the way. But still great! Plus, it's purple :)
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: But this tool is super handy, and allows you to work more creatively ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this won't replace an expensive blender and has limitations. Yes, you shouldn't use it is a softer plastic bowl as the metal guards will dent the plastic. Yes, there is a learning curve of learning to use it without getting splattered. But this tool is super handy, and allows you to work more creatively and quickly. As an example-I've made mashed cauliflower by dumping steamed cauliflower and butter in a glass bread pan and blending, then adding milk until it hits the right consistency. When my mom saw how easy it was she wanted one. I've had it for a couple years, and knock on wood, it doesn't seem worse for the wear.
customer_reviews.author: Semi-City Girl

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CSB-76MR SmartStick 200-Watt Immersion Hand Blender, Metallic Red
product_meta.description:
Color:Metallic Red

CUISINART SMART STICK HAND BLENDER
 You will find blending easier than ever with this Cuisinart Smart Stick hand blender. Pick it up to blend cold drinks, hot soups, and crêpe batter – right in the pitcher, pot or bowl. It’s comfortable to hold, easy to use, and the blending shaft and beaker are dishwasher safe. Enjoy! 

This Cuisinart Smart Stick Hand Blender is designed to handle a variety of basic tasks. Elegant brushed chrome or a variety of bold colors houses a powerful motor, and the handy “stick” design lets you blend in a pot, bowl, or pitcher. Operation is easy and cleanup is quick. What could be better?

What’s your favorite color? Cuisinart Smart Stick Hand Blender now available in a variety of colors. PRODUCT FEATURES


 *  
 *  Powerful 200-watt motor handles more blending tasks
   
 *  Stick design reaches into pots, pitchers, and bowls to extend blending options
   
 *  Ergonomically designed grip offers comfortable hold and more control while blending
   
 *  Operates with a one-touch control for easy, one-handed blending
   
 *  Dishwasher-safe blending shaft and beaker make cleanup effortless
   



WARRANTY
The Cuisinart Smart Stick Hand Blender has a limited three-year warranty. 

Blends drinks, sauces, dressings, dips, purées soup, mixes pancake and crêpe batters in seconds! FEATURES AND BENEFITS


 1.  One Touch On/Off Button: Allows you to activate the hand blender at the touch of a button. Simply press and hold down on the toggle switch to blend or pulse. Once the button is released, blending will stop.
 2.  
 3.   
 4.  Comfort Handle: The handle allows you to control the hand blender with ease. 
 5.  
 6.   
 7.  Motor Body Housing: A powerful 200-watt motor operates with an easy one-touch control.
 8.  
 9.   
 10. Detachable Shaft: By pressing the release button on the back of the unit, the shaft will detach for easy cleaning. 
 11. 
 12.  
 13. Blending Attachment with Stainless Steel Blade and Blade Guard: This attachment easily snaps into the motor body housing. The stainless blade is partially covered by a stainless housing that keeps splashing to a minimum.
 14. 
 15.  
 16. Mixing Beaker: 2-Cup mixing beaker is microwave-safe and dishwasher-safe. Use this container to blend drinks, shakes, salad dressings and more. Designed for easy gripping and drip-free pouring.



OPERATING THE HAND BLENDER
The specially designed blade is for mixing and stirring all kinds of foods, including salad dressings, powdered drink products, and sauces. It is ideal for combining dry ingredients, and can be used to emulsify mayonnaise, too. 

This blade mixes and stirs while adding only a minimum of air to your mixture. A gentle up-and-down motion is all you need to make the most flavorful, full-bodied liquid recipes.

CLEANING
Always clean the Smart Stick motor body and blending shaft thoroughly after using.

 

Remove the blending shaft from the motor body. Clean the motor body only with a sponge or damp cloth. Do not use abrasive cleaners which could scratch the surface. To clean the blending shaft, wash by hand in hot water using mild detergent, or in the dishwasher.
feature_bullets: Immersion hand blender equipped with powerful 200-watt motor
Blade provides smooth blending; protective guard helps prevent splattering
Simple push-button controls and lightweight design for one-handed operation
Dishwasher-safe stainless-steel blending shaft; 2-cup plastic beaker included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,084 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
